text: Machine learning (ML) represents a pivotal aspect of artificial intelligence (AI) poised to redefine the landscape of the twenty-first century. Recent advancements in ML architecture, algorithms, and the proliferation of vast datasets have propelled significant strides in computer capabilities across diverse domains. These include autonomous driving, language translation, chatbots, and even surpassing human proficiency in intricate board games like Go. In this review, we delve into the foundational principles and algorithms underpinning machine learning, elucidating specific methodologies for learning and optimization. Furthermore, we provide an overview of ML applications in the field of medicine, with a focus on recent diagnostic advancements and considerations within dermatology, radiology, pathology, and general microscopy.
name: bla-104
